title.bibl: Danish Times, July 15, 1934. The Fourth of July Moves to Denmark(Editorial)

div.bibl: Danish Times, July 15, 1934. THE FOURTH OF JULY MOVES TO DENMARK(Editorial)

body.p: All in all, Uncle Sam has probably had few friends quite as sincere and unselfish as Denmark. The form of "international entanglement" existing between the two nations is one that even George Washington would surely have sanctioned. In fact, a few more American parks of the Rebild type, judiciously scattered, might even enhance our national security, and several parks could be established for the price of a single pocket battleship.
